body_html:
I dont think this works just yet. the size of libtensorflow_cc.so would push the pip package even bigger (_cc.so is huge) and the pip package is already really big. But more importantly, last I heard the C++ API/ABI was not stable yet so I don't think shipping it is necesarily a good idea.

That said, I do ship _cc.so in the Gentoo TF package but I do it in /usr/lib64/ not under the python package.

Also, this is related: #18360

That said, I do ship _cc.so in the Gentoo TF package but I do it in /usr/lib64/ not under the python package.
Also, this is related: #18360
body:
I dont think this works just yet. the size of libtensorflow_cc.so would push the pip package even bigger (_cc.so is huge) and the pip package is already really big. But more importantly, last I heard the C++ API/ABI was not stable yet so I don't think shipping it is necesarily a good idea.

That said, I do ship _cc.so in the Gentoo TF package but I do it in /usr/lib64/ not under the python package.

Also, this is related: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/18360
